intro: Chomelia caurensis, commonly known as the curved chomelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. Chomelia caurensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
